intro: Pyrenaria brevisepala, commonly known as the short-lobed pyrenaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant produces tiny, dry fruits called achenes, which are typically dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in the understory of temperate forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
